III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158 Intervention standards and prohibitions.
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited
to:
(ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or pushing a youth on
any part of their body.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On 8/27/2023 at approximately 9:30pm in Youth A's bedroom,
Staff 1 pushed Youth A. Youth A has a dime size bruise on her
right elbow and a quarter size bruise on her right hip bone. No
other details provided.
Investigation Administrator 1 was interviewed face to face at the facility on
8/31/23 in collaboration with MDHHS worker. She reported
being aware of the allegations. Staff 1 reported to her that Staff 1
held her arm out to block Youth A when Youth A ran into Staff 1’s
arm causing Youth A to fall to the floor. Youth A had reported Staff
1 pushed her, causing her to fall into her desk and on the floor.
Administrator 1 reported this incident occurred on Sunday, August
27th. She believes the incident started when Staff 1 received a call
for assistance and attempted to keep Youth A from going after
another youth. Staff were attempting to keep Youth A separated
from Youth B, Youth C, and Youth D because she was threatening
them and very dysregulated. There was no attempt to restrain
Youth A, only to impede her attempts to get to Youth B, Youth C,
and Youth D. She reported staff are trained to avoid physical
contact with youth and use verbal redirection to help defuse the
situation. She reported staff will use themselves as barriers to stop
fights between youth to avoid restraints. She described the
“stripped room” is an extra bedroom down a different hall with
limited items but does have a bed and bedding. The room is
utilized at times for youth with active suicidal thoughts or to
provided space from others.
Youth A was interviewed face to face at the facility on 8/31/23
in collaboration with MDHHS worker. She reported not knowing
why she was being interviewed. Once told the reason for the
interview, she reported getting into it with her peers and trying to
go after them. Youth A was trying to attack Youth B and she
reported Staff 2 held her back. She reported there were several
staff including Staff 1, Staff 2, Staff 3, and Staff 4 in the hallway
2

during the incident between herself and Staff 1 in her bedroom.
She reported trying to get to Youth B, Youth C, and Youth D who
were in their rooms down the hall. Prior to the incident in the room,
Youth A went down the hallway and stood in the doorway of Youth
B, when Youth B threw a bottle and then a shoe at Youth A. Staff
1 moved Youth A back to her room by using her body to direct
Youth A. Once in her room Staff 1 and Staff 2 tried to restrain
Youth A with both of the staff grabbing Youth A’s hands. Youth A
was able to get free and when attempting to rush the door, Staff 1
pushed Youth A with both hands to Youth A’s chest and Youth A
fell backwards striking her elbow on either the wall or desk and
striking her hip on the desk. She showed a bruise on her right
elbow and right hip. Youth A stated she pushed Staff 1 back and
Staff 1 pushed her harder. This caused her to trip over her laundry
basket. Youth A reported having “blackouts” when angry and must
have blacked out because she doesn’t remember much more of
the incident. Youth A also reported not receiving any medical
treatment following the incident and even after she showed the
marks on her elbow to House Supervisor and Staff 2. Youth A
reported feeling safe at times, but she must watch her back
because other youth are “going to come after me”.
Youth B was interviewed face to face at the facility on 9/5/23
in collaboration with MDHHS worker. She reported being
present during the incident and observed Youth A tell Staff 1 she
was racist and fat. Youth B reported Youth A pushed Staff 1 and
overhearing a staff tell Youth A to stop hitting staff. She was
unable to observe what occurred in Youth A’s room because
Youth B was in her room down the hall. Youth B reported feeling
safe at the facility and that staff intervene when any of the youth
are trying to fight each other.
Youth C was interviewed face to face at the facility on 9/5/23
in collaboration with MDHHS worker. She reported Staff 4
pushed her into her room and told her not to come out during the
crisis. Youth A had threatened her, so they were arguing across
the hall. She reported observing Youth A being restrained by Staff
1, Staff 2, and Staff 4 holding Youth A on the floor for a “few
hours”. She also reported being in her room across the hall from
Youth A’s room at this time but “didn’t see what Staff 1, Staff 2,
and Staff 4 were doing on top of Youth A in her room. She then
reported being placed in the “stripped room” and was unable to
see or hearing anything that occurred in Youth A’s room. She then
reported hearing what was occurring through the vent in her room
and gaining information when she spoke with Youth A the next
day. She reported hearing (through the vent) staff say they were
3

not going to get off of Youth A but then reported she could hear
Youth A screaming but couldn’t hear what staff were saying.
Staff 2 was interviewed face to face at the facility on 9/5/23 in
collaboration with MDHHS worker. She reported Youth A and
Youth C got into an argument and began to escalate. Youth C
went to take a shower and upon her return to the hallway, Youth A
began to posture to fight including pulling her hair into a ponytail
and taking off her overshirt. Staff 4 took Youth A to her room in an
attempt to separate her from Youth C and the other youth present.
Youth A was in her room while the other youth walked down the
hall to their rooms. Youth A was talking about other youth’s
families in a negative tone as they walked past her room with Staff
4 standing in the hall to keep the youth from coming out of their
rooms. All of the youth with the exception of Youth C ignored
Youth A. Youth C came out of her room and Youth A began to talk
about Youth C’s brother. Staff 4 and Staff 5 helped Youth C back
into her room using their bodies in a blocking move and began the
calming down process. Because Youth C came back out of her
room, she was moved to the “stripped room” to keep her out of the
situation. Staff 1 received the call for assistance and showed up
on the unit. Youth B was standing in her bedroom doorway yelling
at Youth A’s. Staff 4 was stationed outside of Youth B’s door to
keep her separated from Youth A. Staff 2 reported standing in the
doorway of Youth A’s room with Staff 1 and both were trying to
verbally deescalate Youth A. Staff 2 was standing on the left side
of the doorway and Staff 1 was standing on the right side when
Youth A rushed the doorway in an attempt to get into the hallway.
Staff 2 reported Staff 1 put her arms up and Youth A ran into her
arms, falling backwards. Youth A appeared to trip over her feet but
Youth A told Staff 2 later she had tripped over her laundry basket.
Staff 2 also reported Youth A came towards Staff 1 with “a lot of
force” as she was trying to get out of her room and fight the other
youth. Staff 1 and Staff 2 almost initiated a standing restraint, but
Youth A backed up to a wall and sat on the floor, so they didn’t
touch her. Staff 2 denied restraining Youth A. She denied Staff 1
and herself grabbed Youth A’s hands or any staff pushing Youth
A.
Staff 1 was interviewed face to face at the facility on 9/5/23 in
collaboration with MDHHS worker. She reported receiving an
assistance call after hearing “a lot of yelling”. When she entered
the unit, Youth A and Youth C were yelling at each other. Staff 1
told the other staff to remove Youth C to another hall but was
unable to recall the staff who took Youth C to the “stripped room”.
Staff 1 also reported she went to Youth A’s bedroom doorway and
4

stood on the side of the doorway but wasn’t blocking the door.
She was trying to deescalate Youth A, but Youth A began to yell
and make gestures with her hands and arms. As Youth A ran
towards the doorway, Staff 1 raised her arms to block the doorway
and Youth A ran into her arms. Youth A fell backwards before
trying to get past Staff 1. Youth A started yelling how much she
hates black people and Staff 1 had pushed her. Staff 1 reported
saying they need to initiate a restraint to which Youth A backed up
against the wall and sat down on the floor. Youth A calmed down
and Staff 1 left the room. Staff 1 denied grabbing Youth A’s hands
or pushing her. Staff 1 reported not remembering Youth A hitting
the desk when she fell backwards or Youth A falling to the ground.
Therapist was interviewed face to face at the facility on 9/5/23
in collaboration with MDHHS worker. She reported being Youth
A’s primary therapist. Therapist has been focusing on Dialectical
Behavior Therapy techniques with Youth A and reported Youth A
understands these techniques but struggles to use them when in a
crisis. She also reported the facility is currently working on a
safety plan for the unit because of the conflicts.
House Supervisor was interviewed face to face at the facility
on 9/5/23 in collaboration with MDHHS worker. She reported
not being present when the incident occurred but having Youth A
approach her the next day and report the bruise on her elbow.
Youth A showed her the bruise on her hip the following day after
speaking with Therapist. Youth A informed her, Youth A had
tripped over her laundry basket and fell backwards after Staff 1
pushed her. House Supervisor also reported Youth A didn’t tell her
if the push was hard but that she just fell over the laundry basket.
She reported Staff 1 has a good relationship with the youth and
works “really well” with them. She reported this is the first time
anyone has had an issue with Staff 1.
Staff 3 was interviewed via phone on 9/6/23. She reported only
being present for part of the incident. Staff 3 and Staff 4 had to
block Youth B from coming out of her room because she was after
Youth A. She identified other staff involved as Staff 1, Staff 2, and
Staff 4. Because of the threat of harm from Youth A, Youth C was
moved to the “stripped room” because she came out of her room
yelling at Youth A. Youth A had made statements that she had
something in her room to harm the other youth with. She denied
observing any staff pushing Youth A or Youth C and but observed
Youth A grabbing Staff 2’s arm.
5

Staff 4 was interviewed via phone on 9/6/23. She reported not
witnessing what was going on in Youth A’s bedroom because she
was at the end of the hall in front of Youth B’s room. She reported
Staff 1, Staff 2, Staff 3, and Staff 4 were involved. At the
beginning of the incident and while still at the table in the main
area, Youth A had suggested she had a sharp object she would
use on the other youth, so staff took this very seriously and began
the process of getting the youth separated and to their rooms.
Staff 4 denied pushing Youth C into her room but did suggest
moving quickly to keep her safe. She reported during the
debriefing after the incident, no staff mentioned a restraint was
initiated. She denied witnessing any staff push a youth.
MDHHS worker reported they have no findings to their
investigation.
Documents Reviewed:
Human Resources file for Staff 1 was reviewed. Staff 1 has
disciplinary in her file but unrelated to her interactions with youth.
A safety plan is documented to have been put into place in regard
to this investigation and will end if Staff 1 is cleared of any
violation resulting from this incident. This safety plan involves Staff
1 will not be on the unit of the incident, she will not be involved in
crisis coverage at any other units, and she will engage in a one-
on-one refresher with another Aegis trainer to address alternative
interventions. Training documents indicate Staff 1 is current with
her training and last received training on “crisis prevention & de-
escalation” on 4/25/2023.
Nursing Note dated 8/31/2023 for Youth A. Youth A reported
bruising on her hip and elbow and receiving the bruising Sunday
evening (8/27/23). Youth A’s elbow bruise was examined and
found to be an old bruise with no range of motion in the elbow
being found. The bruise on her right hip appeared to be 4 to 5
days old and she had been able to participate in her usual
activities without limitation.
Significant Event Report Wedgewood Christian Services
dated 8/27/23 for Youth A. This report outlines the events from
the allegations in this report. The description is very similar to
reports provided by staff interviewed. It is documented no
significant injury was being reported to the nurse and the nurse
will monitor and follow up if needed.
Residential Medical Care Procedures (06-01) dated 9/7/2023.
This document outlines the procedure for resident medical care. If
6

a youth has a minor (sore throat, joint pain, low-grade fever)
medical complaint that persists, then staff or the youth should
request a nurse examination. In the case of an injury during a
physical intervention then staff are to develop a plan for medical
intervention consistent with the needs of the youth.
Analysis The facility is found in compliance, as it was found Staff 1 did not
push Youth A based on interviews with staff and youth.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
